storyInfo: The assembled Exemplars confirm their next objective: The Shard. Rhodes Island has formulated their strategy for an Londinium assault. The Lifebone takes flight only to crash land because of a strange environmental interference.

attributes.text: 'Not every meeting has a beautiful ending, Amiya.'
'A lot of stories end suddenly. A lot of stories keep us tossing and turning in our beds. And some stories end... with a long, long sigh.'
'In a wilderness without end, people meet and go their separate ways. But at the crucial moment when we cross paths...'
'No one knows if we should really be saying such solemn goodbyes.'

attributes.content: Come in.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa, you're back!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What's the matter? Look what time it is. You should be in bed, if you don't want Kal'tsit getting angry with you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I know, but... I can't sleep.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Want me to sleep with you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I-It's okay! If you still have work to do, I—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You've been waiting for me all day, haven't you? Did something happen?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Nope! I... Everyone's been very nice to me, and I'm keeping up with my homework, too. I've finished all the assignments Dr. Kal'tsit gave me!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I know you've been really busy and I shouldn't bother you, but... I don't know why... I really wanted to see you today.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Is that right?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Come, Amiya. I'm here.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa kneels down and hugs Amiya.
I'm here for you now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I... I saw you standing here, waiting by yourself while everybody else was gone for so, so long... I still remember the look on your face. I don't get it...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Are you worried about something? Isn't everyone saying we're about to win?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Yes, there's always good news.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Our fighters captured another town. We advanced our position once more... Kazdel, our home, is closer than ever.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Amiya, Babel still has a very long journey ahead of us. Our goal is so far away... I don't actually even know if we're still sailing toward our original destination.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa lets out a brief sigh and looks into the distance. Amiya follows Theresa's gaze, but finds nothing.
Babel does not exist to win victories. It never has.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Victories and scars go hand-in-hand, and... those scars are far more difficult than we ever anticipated to heal.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Or rather... Can they even be healed?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa's voice is very soft, almost like a dream melted away in water. As a cloud of mist rises, the brief, momentary smile that she had before now seems distant and hazy.
The young Cautus girl thinks that, for a moment or two, the woman holding her hand all this time almost seemed to have disappeared into the mist herself.

And so Amiya makes the effort to stand on her tiptoes and stretches her hand out. The young girl's soft fingertips touch the forehead between the eyes of the King of Sarkaz; she tries to smooth those knitted brows.
They can... They will.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Theresa, I still remember what you told me.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: 'Perhaps, one day... We'll be able to let everyone on this vast land fall into peaceful slumber.'
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Right. That includes you... and me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Go, Amiya. We have lots of time to talk about the future, but if you stay up all night, you won't be getting any taller.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What are you going to do if you're still a teeny tiny bean by the time Rhodes Island is proudly sailing across the vast lands?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: *whimper*...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If I... If I point my ears up, I'll look taller, won't I?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Pff... Haha...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You really don't want to go back to your room, don't you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I-I'm not being naughty! I'm just—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Alright, let's not tell Kal'tsit, then. You can stay a little longer.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's been a while since I told you a story, hasn't it?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's okay. I still remember all the stories you told me!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: 'A long time ago, there was a great, big desert and a tiny, little doll made of sackcloth. The little puppet swore he would cross the desert to find the legendary Plains of Hope...'
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But you've never told me how the story ends—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Oh, that one, huh...?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There were a lot of scary things out there in the desert. If I were to tell you, you'd never sleep again.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm not scared of them. Besides, with you telling the story, I'm sure it'll have a nice ending.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The desert...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It was so vast and wide, like there was no end to it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Our little puppet had been through many great adventures, and at last, he made it. His goal was right in front of him. The Plains of Hope...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What were the plains like?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Hm... The kind of place that anyone would like to call home.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The kind of place with all the carrot pies I could eat? With everybody on the landship there, too?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Maybe.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But things are never that easy in these stories. He still had to overcome the last obstacle that stood in his way.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The desert was very cold, and the wind there never stopped. In the light of the twin moons, there seemed to be some black cloaked shadows whispering to themselves, but the moment he looked for them, they disappeared.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What were the black cloaked shadows?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: They were the echoes of the oldest despair and sadness. If they catch you, you'll never escape them.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The shadows whispered among themselves and laid trap after trap to stop the puppet...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The black-cloaked shadows didn't want to let the puppet make it any further. They did everything they could to try to get him to turn around.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Because if the puppet made it through the desert, hope would start to spread their way, and they would disappear.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But the puppet didn't know that. His goal never once changed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The puppet made it past their traps and foiled their plans. All the tricks they had up their sleeves had failed. They were furious, and they decided they weren't going to hide anymore. They were going to duke it out with the puppet and fight him to the death.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: When he saw the shadows rushing toward him, the puppet took out a long spear made of a needle and some threads. Then, he—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa, why did they become the echoes of despair and sadness?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Well, about that...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Did they catch Oripathy? And the pain kept them up at night?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Then, maybe the puppet could cure them? Just like what you and Dr. Kal'tsit want to do.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Cure them?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If the puppet cured them and turned them into... hm... happy and peaceful shadows, then everybody could go to the Plains of Hope together, right?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Were they born baddies who liked to scare people?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No, dear, of course not.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The puppet found out that... they all had wounds on their bodies. It was the wounds that turned them into who they were.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Couldn't he fix them up with his needle and thread? Just like what you always do!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Maybe... Perhaps it's worth a try.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: (Yawns)
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Sleepy?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: N-No, I'm not! Did he do it?!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The puppet tried over and over. The stitches were thick and ugly. The black-cloaked shadows were livid.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Wh-What happened next...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Maybe... peace and happiness don't really come so easily, but in the end, they decided to let the puppet go.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The black-cloaked shadows watched the puppet walk into the distance. They decided they'd let the puppet give it a shot, but... a big river stood before him.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He didn't even know how wide it was. All he knew was that he couldn't see the other side of the river.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He knew that the Plains of Hope were on the other side, but there weren't any boats nearby. There wasn't even a decently sized frond.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'What do I do now?' The puppet thought to himself, and he decided to see if he could swim across.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But... he's a... cloth puppet...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Right, he was made of cloth. If he got wet, he would only get heavier and heavier until he sank to the bottom of the river.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But if he stopped here, his journey would have been for nothing.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He leapt into the water and found that the river was cold and salty, like tears.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Apparently... a lot of people across the lands wanted to go to those plains, but not one of them succeeded.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It was their tears that formed this river. The puppet finally understood just how many people shed tears over this.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Zzz...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The puppet swam and swam. He felt his body slowly soaking up the tears.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Did the other side of the river really exist? Perhaps the shadows were right. It was called the 'Plains of Hope' because no one could truly make it there.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: People speak different languages, and their hearts are not connected.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Home. Home.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But a river meant that there must also be a source to return to.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Sleep soundly, Amiya.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Good night.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.text: Amiya has no idea how she got back to her room. That night, she slept very soundly.
Did the puppet make it across the shore? What happened in the end?
A ravine suddenly appeared. Just like that, the two sides have lost contact.

attributes.content: Ah! Doctor, when did you get back?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Is everyone waiting for me? I'm sorry. I'll just need a minute...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Good job with the battle.;You did well during the battle.

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's okay, Doctor. I'm all ready.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Let's head over there together.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We're about ready for departure. Every one of us has to leave Brentwood. Good thing these bones are large enough for us all to fit.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Military Commission must already have caught wind that we've taken control of the town and the Lifebone. It goes without saying that the skeleton is of tremendous importance.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Their counter-offensive might already be on the way. Perhaps the Sarkaz are watching our every move as we speak.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ever since their rapid tactical unit, the Witchling, took to the skies... it's always felt like somebody's been watching us in the mist. It's unnerving.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The battle will only get more dangerous from here on out.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We all know that. The Exemplars will not give up their counter-offensive on Londinium. We have no other choice.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Victoria's people have endured this long enough already.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Good thing we seized the skeleton. Under ideal conditions, it will serve as a temporary stronghold. The wounded and civilians will also get to settle down a little.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Besides, if what Hoederer said is true, it can teleport anywhere, although it might make the users nauseous.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: This is indeed some much appreciated help, but something is bothering me...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Why wouldn't the Military Commission defend such an important transport to the death?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Perhaps they gave up because of the pressure of the battlefield, or perhaps Duq'arael... the Sanguinarch underestimated his enemies...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But it's more likely that their plan in Londinium has already reached a stage where... they can't afford to worry about anything happening outside.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Sanguinarch still completed his final ritual. That may be exactly why they turned their gaze not to the Lifebone, but somewhere else.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Hoederer has finished negotiating with the consciousness left in the skeleton. It will... yes... 'listen to our proposal.' With its help, we will be able to return to the battlefield at any moment.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Most importantly, it gave us an opportunity to get close to the airship and the Shard.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: If we make use of this trump card well... Just maybe, we'll be able to mount an airborne assault on Central Londinium.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Take out their headquarters directly. Good. I like that.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The area around the Shard is heavily guarded, and my guess is that the Military Commission's airship won't let us hover over their heads without a fight.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: All we can do is find an opening for our strike team to enter, and as soon as they've made it in, we'll have the Lifebone depart.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: That means the strike team can't retreat.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But at the same time, we still have to get to the bottom of what's been bothering Amiya: What exactly are the Sarkaz planning?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And how to foil their little tricks.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We won't be able to take the Shard with this little time by ourselves, but... we still have friends inside that massive city. We need to get in touch with them.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: According to our intelligence, there likely aren't many combatants stationed inside the Shard.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Based on my experience fighting their commander, if Theresis... Amiya, what would you say our chances are?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No, we should avoid a direct confrontation with him at all costs. No one is strong enough to singlehandedly defeat Theresis.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Besides, our greatest threat right now is not a single powerful Sarkaz hero. Rather, it is their ambition to see their plans come to fruition.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We will only be able to end this war quickly by stopping it from happening.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: A few squads on their own can't end a war. We still need the Victorian military.
attributes.name: Horn
Horn
attributes.content: It's true that the Duke of Windermere perishing on the front lines is beyond what any of us might have...

attributes.name: Horn
attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.joined: It's true that the Duke of Windermere perishing on the front lines is beyond what any of us might have...Oh.

attributes.content: Forgive me... Lady Delphine.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Standing beside you now is an intelligence officer in the service of Duke Windermere, not her daughter.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Pay me no mind.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Duke of Windermere's untimely passing has disrupted the fragile balance on the outskirts of Londinium. They are on the brink of war.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Heh, until a few weeks ago, I was still under the impression that if the dukes were to put their minds to it and attack Londinium together, a Sarkaz defeat would have been all but assured.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: This will be a decisive battle, one far worse than what any of the bigwigs have been anticipating.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I'd like to say they wished this upon themselves, but it's the frontline soldiers and innocent citizens who are suffering right now.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: So, when the time comes... who's going to win? Us, the Exemplars, or the dukes?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Uh, sorry, I guess I shouldn't be asking that before an operation?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It's fine. I know what it is you're worried about.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But there's no need to worry. A great many people stood up, raised their heads, and woke from their dreams because of this calamity, whether willingly or forced.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You are far from the only ones.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We need to focus on the problem at hand: How to break through the battlefield for our Londinium counter-offensive, as well as how to stop the Shard's strikes.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.options: It won't be easy.;The next step in the Sarkaz plan most likely has to do with Originium.
It's very likely that they will apply ancient Sarkaz research on Originium.;We don't have time. We need to decide on a route for our advance.
Taking the battlefield head-on is our one and only choice.

attributes.content: We received a transmission indicating we have several Rhodes Island support teams on the way.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: There are many things we will only be able to accomplish here as Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I will command their operation.;I will see our strategy executed flawlessly.
And put this crisis behind us.

attributes.content: It seems none of us have any objections. That being the case...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Everyone turns to Amiya.
Suddenly, you feel a hint of relief, gratification, excitement, and pride.
After all, you are standing right beside her.
This war has come to a head, and Theresis intends to use some more decisive and forceful means to tear Victoria to shreds.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: This has nothing to do with whether the Sarkaz truly have a right to revenge. It has nothing to do with whether the nobles may bear this heavy burden for Victoria.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If we solve all our problems by destroying our enemies, then this land, plagued by war from the beginning, has no hope.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Confessarii and Theresis are there, at the heart of Londinium, toppling this empire standing on shaky ground.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I will go to them. And I will stop them.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: For that future, and for the future of all.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Isn't a big gap like this a waste?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I got some real juicy explosives from Closure, enough to pack every corner of this place full.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hah, and they're still cooking up stupid ideas like mounting an attack on Londinium. This is the Military Commission we're talking about. Who knows what tricks Theresis's got up his sleeve?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: So?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Bomb the place, straight up.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Heh, why do you think the Military Commission went through all that trouble to hide this skeleton, instead of treating it as a second airship?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: This thing is fragile. It's only thanks to the witchcraft device that we can communicate with the Feranmut's lingering breath of life. An attack, no matter how weak, could spell the end of it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You think I'm talking about dropping bombs out of it? I'm saying let's make it the bomb.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: A bomb that can fly just about anywhere it wants, that can fly right into Theresis's face at any moment. The perfect bomb.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What? You're still thinking about letting it take us back to Kazdel? If we don't deal with Theresis, we aren't going anywhere.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Let's take the simplest path to solving our problems here.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: *sigh*.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Got something to share with the class?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Nothing at all, but I didn't expect to see you so tense.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Should I teach you a few deep breathing techniques?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Whatever, W. Get in the right frame of mind for this operation. Otherwise, no amount of explosives is going to fix what's going on in your head.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That just means we're gonna need even more bombs.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: If you say so.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Ines.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Remember when we ran into that Lich the other day...? Never mind. Forget it—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You're wondering whether the Theresa out there's real or not again, aren't you?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hmph, enough of that already. I'm not the one you need to convince.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I wasn't the one who called her a fake first either.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Ugh... Did I ever tell you your Arts are disgusting?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I didn't need to read your shadow. You've been pretty anxious for a while now.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What will you do, if you run into her again?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I told you. It's a fake. I'm gonna kill it and be done with this.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: And what if it's not?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Then I'll rescue her and get to the bottom of everything.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That's Theresa.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I think you don't. You haven't figured out how to treat Theresa, how to handle an... enemy leader.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That's a taboo, and you know it far better than I do.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, Ines. You know what pisses me off the most?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I remember a lot of stuff. I remember the crystal on the head of the old fart who taught me how to make explosives. I remember the prices on your heads...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I remember how Her Highness wrestled with that door, and how Kal'tsit once got her hair caught in the same door.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I remember all these things that don't fucking matter!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...But I don't remember—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I can't for the life of me remember when the last time I saw her was, or even... what we talked about.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah, I barely ever had a normal conversation with her.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: There were so many of us on the ship. I was small potatoes, and she was Babel's chairman. It was probably a joke, some silly complaint or nagging—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But it definitely wasn't... a goodbye.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: This time, I'll make up for that and say it. Then, I won't forget.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Anyways... I've gotta get my mercs checking over their equipment. This is gonna be one hell of a job.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Whatever you say.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But if your legs give out on you and you need somebody to give you a good kick in the ass, you know who to call.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: This nightmare has gone on long enough. We should be looking straight ahead.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: All preparations are complete. The airship is ready to take flight.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It will all be over soon.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Come, walk with me one last time, Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Very well...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Military Commission of Kazdel has secretly constructed airship docks just like this one in the support layers of several sectors throughout Londinium. This is the largest among them, and it is where the airship was born.
The ship is seen as a terrifying weapon of war, a herald of destruction, and a flying fortress.
But very few are aware of the original intent behind the airship's construction. It is to uncover a buried secret...
And, beyond that, it is to break free of an eternal shackle.
The brother and sister are walking in the great ship dock, down a long passageway, where every Sarkaz they pass stops and greets the two of them.
When was the last time they had a nice walk like this together? Thinking about it, compared to the amount of time they have spent together, the days that have passed is nothing.
But they were also long enough.
What's on your mind, Theresa?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I suddenly remembered that when Kazdel was rebuilt into a nomadic city, we stood next to each other on the city walls, shoulder-to-shoulder, just like this.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It was supposed to be a happy day, but then it rained.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Some said it was a bad omen, but I still remember how the Soul Furnace's flames looked all the brighter in the rain.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And there's more. I'm suddenly remembering so, so much... It's been too long.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It has been too long indeed.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: From Kazdel to Kazdel... our goal lies right before us. There is but one last step in our plan.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Those who walk after us will find a great city standing tall upon this land, and we Sarkaz will do as we wish, seizing control of our own fate.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I need you.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes... I know.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The warriors who once firmly believed in your path, the girl who is called the King of Sarkaz... They've all come before you now.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Of course they came. I've always believed they would.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have you decided how you will confront them?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I've never once been confused, but... I had hoped this day would take longer to arrive. Now that it's come to this, I actually feel...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I underestimated those I should have had faith in.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresis, I'm delighted.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm delighted that even after we made this decision, they are still willing to stand up against us.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: They are decisive and strong, and they are growing at an unimaginable pace. Perhaps they will make their way to you in the end.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: They may be much stronger now than the woman I was... the one who couldn't accomplish anything.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm looking forward to it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Then... It's time for me to leave, too.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa steps onto the airship's gangway, while Theresis remains where he stands, quietly watching her.
Theresa.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: This time, we should bid each other a proper farewell.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresa reaches her hand out and smooths out the creases on Theresis's cloak.
...(Ancient Sarkaz language) Goodbye.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: (Ancient Sarkaz language) Goodbye.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The silence lasts until the steel door closes and its thick shadow shrouds the two of them.
They say nothing more.
The pulsing of the myriad souls is ceaseless. Theresa lightly closes her eyes to bear with its surge.
The endless murmurs are like the tide. It exhausts, it drags those within it ever downward, and it suffocates.
Perhaps within it once existed brief moments of happiness or the occasional delight... but there is simply too much pain... so much that the pain permeates every word and sentence.
O myriad souls... Even though I have almost completely exhausted myself, I still cannot see the other side.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Shattered hearts abound on these lands.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And so, even if I have only grief at my disposal... even if my body was wrought of tears...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Be my oar, and be my ark.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Let tears carry tears, and let suffering lift up suffering.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's time that we... set sail.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Logos is examining the bone whistle in his hands. He knows every pattern carved into it and every wear and tear on its surface.
He remembers receiving this from his mother when he was still a small child. Its sound was not nearly as sonorous and vivid as it is now.
So this is a Banshee's bone whistle. It's my first time seeing the real thing.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Banshees are a rare sight among mercenaries to begin with, much less one with a bone whistle.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: That said, I've heard plenty of stories about bone whistle—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's a symbol of terror. Its sound foretells death's pursuit.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The Banshees portend death, and willingly serve as the embodiment of death and danger.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But I rarely ever saw you use the whistle, not at Babel all those years ago or at Rhodes Island now.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The Vampire... accused you of rejecting the power of your bloodline.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It already sounded. It need not sound again.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Metaphors about death itself are a dime a dozen, but what comes after death?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: True, the Banshees portend death, but nothing more.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: If death wasn't the end of all beings and there was more than nothingness after the toll of the death knell, then this foretelling would have been meaningless.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: That's why we set down the bone whistles for bone pens.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: New meaning is born from the pens' tips, while the past... is only recorded by the same tips.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This is why we stand together now, Hoederer.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Is that right?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Yes, toward the other side of death. Rebirth.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It matters not what Theresis intends to accomplish. This war will not and cannot be allowed to develop into a raging fire that destroys the Sarkaz, as history has seen countless times before.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Having burned for so long, this hatred cannot be easily extinguished, but we can stop it from engulfing all souls upon these lands.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That includes each and every race there is.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, hold on tight.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The final battle... is able to begin.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Feranmut's skeleton wriggles its body and once again dives straight into history.
The fragments of time are like bubbles in a muddled stream. After they break up, the remains are still vague and indistinct.
Amiya feels the rippling spacetime rushing past her. You look at her and see her eyelashes twitching. What exactly does she see?
Perhaps nothing more than reflections passing by, or fleeting hallucinations.
The distance between memories and history is always much longer than we expect.
Countless sceneries, both ancient and modern, sweep by under the Feranmut's frame.
Those who find themselves within are astonished by this advancement or regression of times, the disasters that unfold before them, and the happiness in their hands...
But when looking upon them from high above, perhaps these sights have never actually changed.
Then, the illusion grows much stranger and more twisted.
A seed is rapaciously absorbing nutrients. It writhes, whimpers, trying to tear away all fabricated representation.
This creation, far beyond human comprehension, waits silently. The slightest movement is enough to rend the continent and allow the crystals to proliferate.
No, this isn't right.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: This isn't the Feranmut's power!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The sky... The entire sky is burning red!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The Lifebone is out of control. It's been pulled off its original course!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Are we under attack?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.options: Prepare to meet the enemy!;Ready damage control!

attributes.content: Guard the entrances to all cabins! Watch for attacking aircraft!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We're preparing anti-boarding measures. All non-combatants, retreat to your shelters!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Mercs, fan out! Don't let any drooling morons onto the ship!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Any damage reports?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'm checking, but—What's going on? This makes no sense!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The sensors I set up are all reading normal. The skeleton's not damaged at all!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I just got word from the observation post. They've spotted no enemies!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We're losing altitude! I can't control it!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What the *Sarkaz expletive* is happening?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Isn't this skeleton your best friend, Hoederer? Get it to chill out!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hoederer, can you adjust the course at all? We mustn't land in the center of the battlefield!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm trying!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Buckle up, everybody. I don't want anyone getting flung out through the gaps in the bones!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I've sent out all my drones to try to pull the Feranmut's bones back and reduce the impact of the crash!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Don't get your hopes up, though!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Our descent isn't slowing. Going by the current speed...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: We'll hit the ground very soon.

attributes.content: 'The meaning of language shall grant us wings.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: 'I command these words to lift this weight.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It's working—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Keep chanting your incantations, Banshee. Hoederer, keep steering us north!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: There's a valley there. We should fit right in!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'm on it, but my link with the Feranmut is fading. I can't control it much longer!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mon3tr.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Excited howling)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Protect the Doctor. Prepare for impact.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Joyful howling)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: This isn't exactly comfy.;...;Its claws are digging into me!

attributes.content: Calm down, Doctor. You'll be fine.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Amiya, how are things going over—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: All the wounded and civilians have been relocated. Feist and Rockrock are working on getting the transport secured.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Got it. Ines, my mercs have anything to say?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: They're all here with me, working on getting some witchcraft going.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We'll need a little more time. We should be able to withstand half of the impact's force.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Tell Hoederer these bones won't shatter here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The valley's in sight. Our angle's not quite there yet. We need to turn left by another twenty degrees!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Last chance for adjustments!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Twenty degrees, I'm certain of it!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: All hands, brace for impact!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The rest comes down to luck!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Ten seconds to impact!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Five, four, three—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Two!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: One!
attributes.name: W
